frameDefinitions: A person (Speaker) expresses a Message or mental content, broadly understood, in a particular Manner.

A Communicator speaks to an Addressee in such a way that the Addressee understands and fully appreciates the truth and/or relevance of the Message.   ' Marred by overblown writing , this first novel by Wilbur Smith 's wife effectively conveys some of South Africa 's problems .
An Agent who is engaged in an Undertaking accords a Degree of importance to a Consideration that influences the success of an Undertaking.
An Agent acts according to a <em>
This frame concerns a Cognizer's certainty about the correctness of beliefs  or expectations.
An Agent, Actor, Entity, or Medium causes a Phenomenon to be perceived by a Perceiver.
frameExamples: Marred by overblown writing , this first novel by Wilbur Smith 's wife effectively <t>conveys</t> some of South Africa 's problems .INI
Our company <t>emphasizes</t> marketing tried and true products and services.INI
Health authorities say they have put measures into <t>effect</t> in all ports of entry and in centers of provinces.
Lermontov was <t>certain</t> he would come to the party.
listRoleDefinitions: <fen>Speaker</fen>, the person who encodes the <fen>Message</fen>, occurs as the External Argument of all the verbs:
The <fen>Message</fen> is almost invariably expressed in an NP Object. (The only exceptions occur with the verb <t>express</t>, which is occasionally used with that-clause complements.)

For most of the words in this frame, some expression of <fen>Manner</fen> or <fen>Medium</fen> is obligatory. As in other frames, <fen>Manner</fen> expressions characterize the action (in this case, the speech act performed by the <fen>Speaker</fen>). However, a wide range of <fen>Manner</fen> expressions occurs in this frame, including the following types:
<fen>Medium</fen> expresses the <fen>Medium</fen> of communication, such as the language used or the specific type of text in which the <fen>Message</fen> occurs:
The person who uses language in the written or spoken modality to convey a <fen>Message</fen> to another person.
The <fen>Addressee</fen> receives a <fen>Message</fen> from the <fen>Communicator</fen>.
<fen>Message</fen> A proposition or set of propositions that the <fen>Communicator</fen> wants the <fen>Addressee</fen> to believe or take for granted.
The physical or abstract setting in which the <fen>Message</fen> is conveyed.
The time at which the communication takes place.
An event or state of affairs, an attribute, or an entity whose properties have the potential to influence the success of the <fen>Agent</fen>'s <fen>Undertaking</fen>.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the individual who devotes time, concentration, or other resources to a <fen>Consideration</fen> that is important for the success of a larger <fen>Undertaking</fen>.
The <fen>Competing_consideration</fen> is another factor that is relevant to the <fen>Undertaking</fen> to which the <fen>Agent</fen> devotes less attention or effort.
The <fen>Artifact</fen> is a physical object designed with some <fen>Consideration</fen> in mind, such that it functions to facilitate the <fen>Undertaking</fen>.
The <fen>Action</fen> is performed with importance placed on the <fen>Consideration</fen>.
The time period during which the <fen>Agent</fen> attaches a specified degree of importance to the <fen>Consideration</fen> to further the success of the <fen>Undertaking</fen>.
The location in which the <fen>Agent</fen> attaches the specified level of importance  to the <fen>Consideration</fen>.
The <fen>Plan</fen> is a goal or purpose that the <fen>Agent</fen> carries out.

The <fen>Agent</fen>, often an institution or governmental organization, puts a <fen>Plan</fen> into effect. The Agent is generally a primary participant in the <fen>Plan</fen>, but a separate <fen>Focal_participant</fen> may be specified.
This role describes the medium through which a plan was executed.  It may occur in the same syntactic position as the Agent.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the Agent puts the <fen>Plan</fen> into effect.

The <fen>Place</fen> at which the <fen>Plan</fen> is or is not operational.

[CHANGE: or, place where agent puts into effect? 2 fes?]
The <fen>Cognizer</fen> is the person whose certainty or uncertainty is at issue.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the entity that a <fen>Cognizer</fen> has a certain/uncertain belief about.
The <fen>Content</fen> denotes the mental content that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> is certain or uncertain about.
The <fen>Expressor</fen> is the body part or action by a body part that conveys the mental state of  the <fen>Cognizer</fen>.
The <fen>Agent</fen> intentionally creates a situation in which the <fen>Perceiver</fen> observes or experiences the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>.
The <fen>Phenomenon</fen> is an entity or idea that is perceived by the <fen>Perceiver</fen>.
The <fen>Perceiver</fen> is made to have a perceptual experience by the <fen>Agent</fen>.
An <fen>Actor</fen> is a sentient being who is exhibiting, possibly uninintentionally, some <fen>Phenomenon</fen>.
An object that has some association with a <fen>Phenomenon</fen>.
The <fen>Medium</fen> through which a <fen>Phenomenon</fen> is expressed.
When the event occurs.
The location where the <fen>Agent</fen> causes the perception of the <fen>Perceiver</fen>.
listRoleExamples: <fex>The teacher</fex> phrased the question carefully.
The Prime Minister expressed <fex>her sympathy for the victims</fex>.
True Manner: You should phrase it <fex>carefully</fex>.
Kim formulated her objections <fex>in French</fex>.
<fex>Nobody</fex> seems to be able to get the idea through to her that she needs a job!!!!

According to Masztalics, a good teacher uses experiments to get the point across
<fex>to the class</fex>.
He tried to get through to his wife <fex>that the debt he's taken on buying stocks poses no risk</fex>.
<fex>The article</fex> conveys Mr. Handley's disrespect for those who disagree with him.
Greenspan got his point across <fex>yesterday</fex> that a measured pace of rate hikes is still the plan.
The ICBL has prioritised <fex>working to achieve universalisation of the Mine Ban Treaty in South Asia by 2004</fex>.
Dell said Friday <fex>the company</fex> will put more emphasis on selling software
Monophysite Christians  emphasized Christ's divinity <fex>over his humanity</fex>.
Water is a scarce commodity on French Island so <fex>the guest house</fex> places strong emphasis on water conservation.
Result Oriented <fex>Management</fex>
<fex>In the 1960s</fex> Foucault placed great weight on the notion of archeology.
<fex>In Arizona</fex> we emphasize western bats with a special focus on species identification.
The policy will be implemented <fex>by a new computer system</fex>.
<fex>Marcel</fex> was sure that she had seen Eldridge on the balcony.
She talked of quests , of finding this absurd religious character , but he was unsure <fex>of her conviction</fex>.
I am sure <fex>that we'll arrive on time</fex>.
She caught sight of her mother's dubious <fex>expression</fex>.
